attributes.text: Shows a whole meta column. This includes a {@link Header}, a {@link Pane} and the needed scroll bars. This class handles the virtual scrolling and does all the mouse event handling.
the table the scroller belongs to.
The minimum width a column could get in pixels.
The radius of the resize region in pixels.
(int) The mask for the vertical scroll bar. May be combined with {@link #HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR}.
(int) The mask for the horizontal scroll bar. May be combined with {@link #VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR}.
(int) The number of pixels the mouse may move between mouse down and mouse up in order to count as a click.
Dispatched when a sortable header was clicked
See {@link qx.ui.table.Table#cellClick}.
See {@link qx.ui.table.Table#cellContextmenu}.
See {@link qx.ui.table.Table#cellDblclick}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #horizontalScrollBarVisible}.
Dispatched if the pane is scrolled vertically
Dispatched if the pane is scolled horizontally
Fired on change of the property {@link #tablePaneModel}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #verticalScrollBarVisible}.
the current mouse x position.
Common column move logic.
the current mouse x position.
Common column resize logic.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property horizontalScrollBarVisible.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyHorizontalScrollBarVisible}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyVerticalScrollBarVisible}.
the x position in the page (in pixels).
the y position in the page (in pixels).
Sets the focus to the cell that’s located at the page position pageX/pageY. If there is no cell at that position, nothing happens.
the x position of the mouse in the page (in pixels).
Returns the model index of the column the mouse is over or null if the mouse is not over a column.
the model index of the column the mouse is over.
the x position of the mouse in the page (in pixels).
Returns the model index of the column that should be resized when dragging starts here. Returns -1 if the mouse is in no resize region of any column.
the column index.
the mouse x position in the page.
the mouse y position in the page.
Returns the model index of the row the mouse is currently over. Returns -1 if the mouse is over the header. Returns null if the mouse is not over any column.
the model index of the row the mouse is currently over.
Hides the resize line.
Event handler for the scroller’s appear event
the event.
Event handler. Called when the modal window of the cell editor closes.
The data event
Event handler. Called when the event capturing of the header changed. Stops/finishes an active header resize/move session if it lost capturing during the session to stay in a stable state.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user clicked a mouse button over the header.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user clicked a mouse button over the pane.
the event.
Event handler. Called when a context menu is invoked in a cell.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user double clicked a mouse button over the pane.
Event handler for the disappear event
Timer event handler. Periodically checks whether a table update is required. The update interval is controlled by the {@link #scrollTimeout} property.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user pressed a mouse button over the header.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user pressed a mouse button over the pane.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user moved the mouse over the header.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user moved the mouse over the pane.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the mouse moved out.
The mouse event
Event handler for the focus indicator’s mouseup event
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user released a mouse button over the header.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user released a mouse button over the pane.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the user moved the mouse wheel.
Event handler. Called when the pane model has changed.
Event listener for the pane clipper’s resize event
the event.
Event handler. Called when the horizontal scroll bar moved.
the event.
Event handler. Called when the vertical scroll bar moved.
Does a postponed update of the content.
the position where to show the line (in pixels, relative to the left side of the pane).
Shows the resize line.
The timeout between two table updates
Starts the current running interval
the column index
x coordinate of the mouse event
Start a move session of the header.
the column index
x coordinate of the mouse event
Start a resize session of the header.
stops the current running interval
Stop a move session of the header.
Stop a resize session of the header.
Updates the content. Sets the right section the table pane should show and does the scrolling.
Updates the location and the visibility of the focus indicator.
Stops editing without writing the editor’s value to the model.
Writes the editor’s value to the model.

Whether to show the horizontal scrollbar always.
Whether to show the vertical scrollbar never.
Returns which scrollbars are needed.
which scrollbars are needed. This may be any combination of {@link #HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR} or {@link #VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR} (combined by OR).
The right inset of the pane. The right inset is the maximum of the top right widget width and the scrollbar width (if visible).
The right inset of the pane

Get the rendered width of the vertical scroll bar. The return value is 0 if the scroll bar is invisible or not yet rendered.
The width of the vertical scroll bar
Hides the feedback shown while a column is moved by the user.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property focusCellOnMouseMove with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

Event handler. Called when the table gets or looses the focus.

Resets the user value of the property focusCellOnMouseMove.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #focusCellOnMouseMove}.

Sets the widget that should be shown in the top right corner.

The widget will not be disposed, when this table scroller is disposed. So the caller has to dispose it.

Shows the feedback shown while a column is moved by the user.
the visible x position of the column in the whole table.
Starts editing the currently focused cell. Does nothing if already editing, if the column is not editable, or if the cell editor for the column ascertains that the particular cell is not editable.
whether editing was started
Stops editing and writes the editor’s value to the model.

Updates the maximum of the horizontal scroll bar, so it corresponds to the total width of the columns in the table pane.
Updates the maximum of the vertical scroll bar, so it corresponds to the number of rows in the table.
Whether the focus should moved when the mouse is moved over a cell. If false the focus is only moved on mouse clicks.
Whether to show the horizontal scroll bar
Whether column resize should be live. If false, during resize only a line is shown and the real resize happens when the user releases the mouse button.
Interval time (in milliseconds) for the table update timer. Setting this to 0 clears the timer.

Whether to handle selections via the selection manager before setting the focus. The traditional behavior is to handle selections after setting the focus, but setting the focus means redrawing portions of the table, and some subclasses may want to modify the data to be displayed based on the selection.
Whether the cell focus indicator should be shown
The table pane model.
Whether to show the vertical scroll bar
